definition: to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The number of reputable hero, an instant fall.
sentences.chinese: 有多少英雄名噪一時，瞬間隕落。

sentences.english: Another Western shibboleth about the future will thereby fall.
sentences.chinese: 另一個西方對未來的過氣觀點也會因此隕落。

sentences.english: Can states fail within the developed world?
sentences.chinese: 發達國家中也會有國家走向隕落嗎？

sentences.english: Concluded, dropt in the night, and was gone.
sentences.chinese: 完結，在黑夜中隕落，並永遠消失了。

sentences.english: The national sports is a star in sports domain forever in China.
sentences.chinese: 民族體育是體育領域中永不隕落的星。

sentences.english: Pride goeth before destruction: and the spirit is lifted up before a fall.
sentences.chinese: 驕橫是滅亡的先聲，傲慢是隕落的前導。

sentences.english: 12 in the fall of each star of the evening, again and again for my loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 在每個星光隕落的晚上，一遍一遍數我的寂寞。

sentences.english: During Chunqiu period, Fatality Order declined and Zhou Rite was faced with legitimacy crises.
sentences.chinese: 春秋以降，天命隕落，周禮出現嚴重的合法性危機。

definition: lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
